org.corfudb.runtime.stream

Interface IStream

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAdapterStream, IHopStream
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdapterStream, BasicStream, ReservedStream, SimpleStream

    public interface IStream
extends AutoCloseable
    A stream interface. Streams are slightly more restrictive than logs: Random reads are only possible when given a timestamp, and they must be read starting from the head of the stream.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        ITimestamp append(Serializable data)
           throws OutOfSpaceException,
                  IOException
        Append an object to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Parameters:
        data - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • reserve

        default ITimestamp[] reserve(int numTokens)
                      throws IOException
        Reserves a given number of timestamps in this stream. This operation may or may not retrieve valid timestamps. For example, a move operation may occur and these timestamps will not be valid on the stream.
        Parameters:
        numTokens - The number of tokens to allocate.
        Returns:
        A set of timestamps representing the tokens to allocate.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        default void write(ITimestamp timestamp,
                   Serializable data)
            throws OutOfSpaceException,
                   OverwriteException,
                   IOException
        Write to a specific, previously allocated log position.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to write to.
        data - The data to write to that timestamp.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException - If there is no space left to write to that log position.
        OverwriteException - If something was written to that log position already.
        IOException

      • append

        default ITimestamp append(Serializable payload,
                          Set<UUID> streams)
                   throws OutOfSpaceException,
                          IOException
        Append an object to the stream, along with the set of other objects to which the payload is relevant. This method is deprecated because it represents a way to support multi-object operations (in support of txns) that is too tightly coupled with the stream interface. To wit: what sense does it make for a stream to append things for more than one stream. TODO: FIXME: This will be refactored into a transaction layer at some point in the future.
        Parameters:
        data - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        streams - A list of streams ids to which the given payload applies.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • readNextEntry

        IStreamEntry readNextEntry()
                    throws HoleEncounteredException,
                           TrimmedException,
                           IOException
        Read the next entry in the stream as a IStreamEntry. This function retrieves the next entry in the stream, or null, if there are no more entries in the stream.
        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException

      • readNextObject

        default Object readNextObject()
                       throws HoleEncounteredException,
                              TrimmedException,
                              IOException,
                              InterruptedException,
                              ClassNotFoundException
        Read the next entry in the stream as an Object. This convenience function retrieves the next entry in the stream, blocking if necessary.
        Returns:
        A deserialized object containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException
        InterruptedException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • readEntry

        IStreamEntry readEntry(ITimestamp timestamp)
                throws HoleEncounteredException,
                       TrimmedException,
                       IOException
        Given a timestamp, reads the entry at the timestamp
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to read from.
        Returns:
        The entry located at that timestamp.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException

      • readObject

        default Object readObject(ITimestamp timestamp)
                   throws HoleEncounteredException,
                          TrimmedException,
                          IOException,
                          InterruptedException,
                          ClassNotFoundException
        Read a entry in the stream as an Object. This convenience function retrieves an entry in the stream.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to read from.
        Returns:
        The entry located at that timestamp.
        Throws:
        HoleEncounteredException
        TrimmedException
        IOException
        InterruptedException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • getNextTimestamp

        ITimestamp getNextTimestamp(ITimestamp ts)
        Given a timestamp, get the timestamp in the stream
        Parameters:
        ts - The timestamp to increment.
        Returns:
        The next timestamp in the stream, or null, if there are no next timestamps in the stream.

      • getPreviousTimestamp

        ITimestamp getPreviousTimestamp(ITimestamp ts)
        Given a timestamp, get a proceeding timestamp in the stream.
        Parameters:
        ts - The timestamp to decrement.
        Returns:
        The previous timestamp in the stream, or null, if there are no previous timestamps in the stream.

      • check

        default ITimestamp check()
        Returns a fresh timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream.

      • check

        ITimestamp check(boolean cached)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.

      • getCurrentPosition

        ITimestamp getCurrentPosition()
        Gets the current position the stream has read to (which may not point to an entry in the stream).
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently read address in the stream.

      • trim

        void trim(ITimestamp address)
        Requests a trim on this stream. This function informs the configuration master that the position on this stream is trimmable, and moves the start position of this stream to the new position.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the stream. This method must be called to free resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • getStreamID

        UUID getStreamID()
        Get the ID of the stream.
        Returns:
        The ID of the stream.

      • getInstance

        default ICorfuDBInstance getInstance()
        Get the instance that this stream belongs to.
        Returns:
        The instance the stream belongs to.

      • seek

        default void seek(ITimestamp pos)
        Move the stream pointer to the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to seek to. The next read will occur AFTER this position.
